description: From French hypnagogique, from Ancient Greek ὕπνος (húpnos, “sleep”) + ἀγωγός (agōgós, “leading”).

adjectives.description: hypnagogic (comparative more hypnagogic, superlative most hypnagogic)

entries.meaning: That accompanies falling asleep; especially, pertaining to the semi-conscious period immediately preceding sleep.
